description: Linear algebra: vectors, matrices, systems of linear equations, eigenvalues and eigenvectors. Vector calculus: functions of several variables, vector fields, line and surface integrals, Green's, Stokes' and divergence theorems. Series solutions of ordinary differential equations, Laplace transforms and systems of ordinary differential equations. Use of symbolic manipulation and graphics software.
name: CALCULUS III

values.comments:
Calculus III (MATH 240) is a higher-level Mathematics course that covers a variety of topics including linear algebra, vector calculus, series solutions of ordinary differential equations, Laplace transforms and systems of ordinary differential equations. This course also incorporates the use of symbolic manipulation and graphics software.

Many students felt that they had “learned very little of the proper Math 240 curriculum” from this section of the course taught by Professor Clarke. Midterms were considered “exceptionally hard” and many students felt that they weren’t given enough practice problems.

Students said that Professor Clarke’s lectures were “hard to follow” and “confusing.” Although some students appreciated that he tried to avoid teaching to the final by bringing in extra material, many felt the content covered in class strayed from the curriculum and was hampered by overcomplicated explanations and random tangents. One student commented, “The professor was unable to communicate the content in a comprehensible fashion.” Other students reported that Professor Clarke mostly ignored topics in the book and didn’t “adhere to the prescribed curriculum.” One student would have liked more examples to be solved in class, saying that Professor Clarke “does almost exclusively derivations.” Several students liked Professor Clarke’s “energy and enthusiasm,” saying they thought that he was “generally a nice person, and liked to make jokes.”
